calendar.p: The Julian calendar, as used in England before 1752. The year starts on March 25.

A Hebrew calendar dating from the creation of the world, based on biblical genealogy. The start date varies according to the biblical texts used. Here, based on the dates given for the same events in other formats, this calendar starts in 3962 BC.
A calendar dating from the Roman discovery of Britain. Based on the dates given for the same events in other formats, this calendar starts in 50 BC.

.44. Agencourte Rex Armorum
Sacramentum militum Balnei.
you shall sweare so helpe you god & by this holy Aulter that ye towche that
ye faithfully beleve in Almighty God & his holy churche, & defend
the liberties of thesame. ye shall also owebere faithe to your soueraigne Lord:
the kinge: & his ryte & quarell maynteyne to suffer deathe for yt
ye shall also suffer no extortion to be done to your power. ye shall
also not suffer any false Judgement to be geven to your wyttinge
In witnesse wherof of all these, you shall kysse your sworde &
offer it on this holye Aulter ./ &c./
